stories.title: Understanding AWS Lambda scaling and throughput

stories.text:
There are many articles about efforts to prevent the discovery of abortions in states where they are illegal. When I read them, I wonder why writers think it is possible to remain anonymous in 2022. The attack surface seems wildly large:

- Phone geolocation - Payments - Text messages - Web history - Public security cameras - Biological tests to determine past pregnancy

For example, how does one secure one's browsing history? One need take many, many steps these days, and even then, it is rarely secure.

How is one to complete a payment online anonymously?

Do parcel shipping companies intend to resist court orders mandating disclosure of sender/recipient addresses "outside the envelope"?

How does one travel on a US highway without leaving a record via security cameras?

There are better and worse security practices, but I don't see how a truly determined adversary can fail to discover abortions. And the attacker seems determined.

It suggests the only way to make abortions undiscoverable is to completely rethink our privacy regime.
